creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: two crisscrossed flutes or whistles forming X at center, overlapping vertical musical staff with treble clef; two stylized cherubs sitting on fluttering ends of a banner over the center flutes, each playing an instrument; at top, putto sits on a wreath and holds a burning torch
inscription:
Signature, Inscription, Stamp

-- inscribed in plate within image: [RIDENDO]
-- in graphite on recto, botton of sheet: Cat. 241 - Les Mirlitons Lettura Judic | WW.- | (R.325)
markings: blindstamp on recto, LL: Léon Bournisien, Lugt 3425; watermark: Van Gelder, partial
provenance: Léon Bournisien, Lugt 3425; probably sold to Alain Labat, Paris, May 14-15, 1984. John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: initialed in red pencil below platemark, at center: [F.R]
title: Les Mirlitons (Pour Madame Anna Judic)
